      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException,
                        java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Deconvolutes a set of QTLs given the expression levels, genotypes, and cell counts. Calculates the p-values for the deconvoluted QTLs and writes them to an outfile
        Parameters:
        args - List of command line arguments
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException - If cellcount file is not in right format to be parsed correctly
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If outfolder can not be retrieved from commandLineOptions
        java.io.IOException - If cellcounts file can not be found or read

      • anova

        public static double anova(double sumOfSquaresModelA,
                           double sumOfSquaresModelB,
                           int degreesOfFreedomA,
                           int degreesOfFreedomB,
                           java.lang.Boolean no_intercept)
        Compare and return the p-value of two linear models being significantly different From Joris Meys: http://stackoverflow.com/a/35458157/651779 1. calculate MSE for the largest model by dividing the Residual Sum of Squares (RSS) by the degrees of freedom (df) 2. calculate the MSEdifference by substracting the RSS of both models (result is "Sum of Sq." in the R table), substracting the df for both models (result is "Df" in the R table), and divide these numbers. 3. Divide 2 by 1 and you have the F value 4. calculate the p-value using the F value in 3 and for df the df-difference in the numerator and df of the largest model in the denominator. For more info: http://www.bodowinter.com/tutorial/bw_anova_general.pdf
        Parameters:
        sumOfSquaresModelA - A vector with the genotype of all samples for *one* eQTL-gene pair
        sumOfSquaresModelB - A vector with the expression levels of all samples for *one* eQTL-gene pair
        degreesOfFreedomA - A 2D list with for all samples the different cell counts
        degreesOfFreedomB - A 2D list with for all samples the different cell counts
        no_intercept - If intercept was removed to calculate the sum of squares
        Returns:
        The p-value result from comparing two linear models with the the Anova test

                                         throws java.lang.RuntimeException,
